metadata.titel_preek: On Being Designated Truth Carriers (Reign of Christ)

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The displacement of failed cultural/ideological 'untruths' by the 'long truth' of God's self-giving love embodied in Christ, which then re-clothes the church for its mission.

tekstueel_bewijs: He is the one who makes peace through the blood of his cross
The God who gives God’s self away in love
The truth of our life in God’s world
The road to peace is the offer of the self
The long truth of the world as God’s creation
A truth for which the world waits
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of the truth who is then 'designated' to carry it.

tekstueel_bewijs: Paul musters all the lyrical flow of rhetoric
The rhetoric of baptism, a change of clothes
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject; Christ is the Mediator/Helper of reconciliation.
helper.rol_van_geest: Implicitly the indwelling power ('Let the word of Christ dwell in you richly').

tegenstander.identificatie: Failed Truths (Militarism, Scientism, Ideology, Religious Certitude)
tekstueel_bewijs: Seductions of greed, anxiety, and our ready idolatries
Failed truths of scientism, high finance, militarism
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponents are not just bad habits but systemic 'untruths' that hold the world in 'confused bewilderment' and 'hostility'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The Church (Subject) acting as 'designated hitters' to carry the truth and practice reconciliation (Object).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church / Pastors / Elders
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/ecclesiology) is explicitly presented as a 'turn' or consequence of the primary Christological reality.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The self-giving God who brings peace
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We have trusted the claims we preferred
We made a truth out of much doctrine
You have the mind of Christ

voorbeelden: Every player was designated to hit
Whatever you do... do everything in the name of the Lord
The truth for which we all yearn
Discover that what has been true... is no longer true
Paul knows the old failed truth
May you be made strong with all the strength that comes from his glorious power
Strength that the world judges to be weak

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'epistemological shift'—knowing what is truly true—which then grants the 'Pouvoir' (power) to act differently.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the collapse of S2 (Failed Truths) to the revelation of S1 (Christ), warning against the trap of ~S1 (Ecclesial busyness).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in Christ as the 'quintessential embodiment' of the long truth that holds all things together.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'tsunami of failed truths' is presented as a state of 'free-fall'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon has many 'you' imperatives, they are structurally grounded in the 'done' deal of Christ's self-giving. The church's action is a 'designation' based on a prior gift.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is the quintessential embodiment... [we] engage in self-giving love.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The road to peace is the offer of the self; and he has done it!
We are not self-starters; we start from a gift.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus is presented as the 'embodiment' of truth, but not merely as a hero to imitate; he is the cosmic force holding reality together.
bijbelse_figuren_als_model: Paul (as one swept off his feet)
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon avoids pure exemplarism by emphasizing that Christ's blood 'makes peace'—an ontological change, not just a moral example.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'free-fall' of failed truths; empowerment through gratitude.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from Christology to Ecclesiology is the backbone of the sermon's logic.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'God has no hands but our hands' (rejected) and 'You are the designated hitters' (accepted).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Re-clothed... a change of identity... in the one body.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'strength' given to the church is explicitly 'not worldly strength' but 'his glorious power'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as trusting in 'failed truths' and 'seductions of greed' that lead to hostility.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the primary Subject of the 'Long Truth' while positioning the hearer as a 'Designated' agent of that truth.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The 'designated hitter' metaphor might inadvertently shift the hearer back into a 'performance' mindset.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the 'hitter' only stands at the plate because they were 'called' and 'clothed' by the Manager.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Savoir (knowing the truth).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Connect the 'strength' in v. 11 more explicitly to the Holy Spirit's work in the sacraments.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Maintain the current flow: Collapse of False Truths -> Revelation of Christ -> Designation of Church.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses cultural critique to clear the field for the Gospel Subject.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'lyrical eruption' and metaphors; semiotic analysis reveals that despite the 'you' focus at the end, the 'engine' remains Christ's action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain Colossians; Greimas shows how the sermon's structure mirrors the 'clothing' movement of the text.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Failed Truths' function as a collective Opponent that is defeated not by human effort but by its own ontological emptiness when confronted by the Subject (Christ).

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids moralism by defining 'truth' not as a set of rules but as a person (Christ) and an act (self-giving).
